name: English Chippendale "RUBY WOO" Velvet CamelBack Sofa
description:
This elegant English Chippendale style, 8-legged, newly upholstered camel back sofa is a design dream come true for all AOM antique aficionados. 

I can't begin to tell you my thoughts on where I'd place this elegant stately piece. In the front foyer? The solarium right off the living room?  Directly across from the massive walk in fire place? under the staircase, with tastefully appointed black and white Carrara marble squares that measure 24x24? 

Where is "my" personal sofa, you ask?? Why in my dressing room of course! And its just for my girlfriends and wine. Listen closely and you can hear faint whispers and giggles. Someone always slips off their Blahniks and curls up for a little nappie pooh.

As always, we've completely refurbished and restored this Chippendale to exceptional condition. Call for DIMS! 


RUBY WOO! The true Cherry red lipstick created by MAC Cosmetics that all the celebrities are wearing! Rihanna, Beyonce, Madonna...

Are you on FB? We are. Follow us to see what we're up to!
<iframe src="//www.facebook.com/plugins/follow?href=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.facebook.com%2FAnOrangeMoon&layout=standard&show_faces=true&colorscheme=light&width=450&height=80" scrolling="no" frameborder="0" style="border:none; overflow:hidden; width:450px; height:80px;" allowTransparency="true"></iframe>

name: Harvey Probber Black Leather Sofa
description:
The absolute ultimate! The trendsetter. The KING of design. Ladies and gentlemen, I give to you, HARVEY PROBBER. 

This black leather, three seat sofa pulls out all the stops. AOM loves a sofa! We get to redesign them. Add bells and whistles, but with this PROBBER, there was no need. What we did do was refurbish this sofa to the nines. New cushions, new down, new feather-wraps. This 60 year old leather "moisturized and re-conditioned," is a true testament to quality. 

Be careful of imitators. This lovely carries the PROBBER label. 

This item available for shipping.

An Orange Moon
Lynne & Ty McDaniel
Owner & Founders
2418 W North ave
CHICAGO

name: William Katavolos Pair of Black Leather Sling Chairs.
description:
Me-ow! William Katavolos! The energetic avant-garde designer from the 60's, was KILLER COOL! 

ROWENA AWARD
The 2012 Rowena Reed Kostellow Award was presented to Bill Katavolos on March 8, 2012 at the Knoll Showroom in New York City. William has gratified my design heart by keeping these Black Leather Sling chairs sculptural, yet relaxed. 

These SEXY, RAW, THICK BLACK LEATHER sculptures in their own right, captures the true spirit of what Mid Century Modern living was all about. Where would you flank these? I vote bedroom fireplace. You??

*Did I mention these VINTAGE MINT CONDITION chairs swivel? 

DIMS:

DEPTH:	 30.5 in. (77 cm)

name: Henry P Glass for Richbilt Furniture Walnut Octagonal Dining set & 4 Chairs
description:
Glass fled Vienna with his wife in 1938, and came to New York to design under Gilbert Rodhe and Russel Wright. GILBERT RODHE & RUSSELL WRIGHT! He came straight from Vienna to the "big boys" of design.

2 years later, Henry was at the top of his game, so CHICAGO was his next logical design step.

Henry P Glass is touted as "One of the most ingenious inventors and product designers of the twentieth century." I encourage you to read more about him. 

But I digress--LOOK AT THIS DINING SET he created! It's Walnut! Has THREE leafs! And the piece de resistance is the table is OCTAGONAL! And the LEGS! C'est incroyable. Uh-oh, he's got me speaking French! 

Use this table for an impromptu "buffet"  holiday dinner party. Or utilize all the leafs and follow our lead by adding a couple of your most fabulous lounge chairs to round out your set. 

This piece is perfect for a condo or apartment where space is at a premium, but STYLE is not!

Only at An Orange Moon!
2418 W North Ave
CHICAGO
Ty & Lynne McDaniel
Owners & Founders

WINNER OF BEST OF CHICAGO!

name: Pair of Jydsk Mobelvaerk TEAK Case Sofas
description:
Danish Modern Teak Case Jydsk Mobelvaerk sofas. 

I’m speechless. These TEAK cube case vintage sofa’s by Jydsk Mobelvaerk are GORGEOUS!! They are covered in 100% Wool HOUNDS TOOTH Epingle, and encased in teak and sit regally atop squared chrome metal legs! And to show this designer went the extra mile, look at the leg bottoms. LITTLE TEAK FOOTIES!!

Seriously folks, does it get any better than this?

Condition: MINT. Newly upholstered, vintage case love seats, GREAT VINTAGE CONDITION

Dimensions: H: 24.5 inches: D: 31 inches: L: 62 inches

Fabric:Upholstery is Epingle. Pronounced Epp-Pin-Glay
A type of velvet fabric woven on a wire loom or épinglé loom. The épinglé velvet is specific by the fact that both loop pile and cut pile can be integrated into the same fabric. The art of épinglé weaving in Europe originates from Lucca (Italy) and later Venice and Genua.
It feels like a highest quality velvet sculpted mohair mixed!

https://www.themomgroup.com/downloads/Textus_Construction_Library_Epingle.pdf

*A little trivia? Milo Baughman knocked these off!!

Lynne & Ty McDaniel
Owners & Founders

An Orange Moon
www.anorangemoon.com
312.450.9821 furniture emergency
773.276.ORANGE
2418 W North ave
CHICAGO

WE SHIP!

name: 3 Bay System Cado
description:
Designed by Danish "STARchitect" Poul Cadovius. This TEAK 3 bay "System Cado"  boast multiple shelves and 6 individual boxed compartments that can be placed in your desired position.

Consists of:
1 Liquor Cabinet
2 Storage Cabinets (2 Door)
1 Sliding Glass Cabinet
1 Chest of Drawers (4 Drawers)
1 Record Cabinet

When this piece came into the shop, it stopped me dead in my tracks! After the installation, I toyed with the idea of keeping it. I can see it clearly on the North wall in our living room, directly across from the fireplace. WE could use our sofa as the divider between the two. But alas, we cannot keep everything. Wah-Wah.

This is an incredible design opportunity. Take advantage folks. Take advantage.

We SHIP! Ring Lynne @ 312.450.9821 for a quote.

name: Johannes Aasbjerg Teak FULL Credenza
description:
Johannes Aasbjerg.  
Here is an excellent example of real old world craftsmanship. 
This FULL credenza in SOLID teak, yes SOLID teak, is a great example of the work of Denmark's Johannes Aasbjerg. Lately, Aasbjerg has been the topic of many a design debate. 

First, we are impressed by this craftsman's chutzpah, as he hand selected & hand crafted each teak board and used the highly regarded method of "dovetailing." 

*This item available by appointment only.

name: Folke Ohlsson for DUX TEAK King Headboard
description:
Dig that! A king Mid Century Modern headboard by Foke Ohlsson for DUX! Here's a little tibit about Folke Ohlsson for Dux: Folke Ohlsson moved to the US from Sweden in 1953, and established DUX, Inc. in San Francisco the same year. In 1959 he moved the company to Burlingame, California. His design is generally referred to as "Scandinavian Modern" but frequently gets categorized as "Danish Modern" or "Danish Teak". A popular designer of the late 1950s early 60s, and highly collectable. DIMS: 80L 34.75H Will you be the proud owner of this historic piece? Need a shipping quote?

Get a shipping quote

name: Pair of Dunbar "C" Shaped Sofa's
description:

name: Harvey Probber American Walnut Credenza
description:
American! American! American! Who says the Danes do it better? No hate mail please. I'd just like to give American designers their due. In the Mid Century Modern industry where TEAK is the buzzword, American designers are getting lost in the fray. "Born in Brooklyn in 1922, Mr. Probber sold his first design, for a sofa when he was 16; it brought $10. By the time he graduated from high school, he was commuting to Manhattan to sell his sketches to furniture manufacturers. He remained largely untrained on a formal basis, though he took evening classes in design at the Pratt Institute, learning furniture production during the day at a job with Trade Upholstery, a New York company." 6 drawers that glide in and out like "butta," the condition of this piece is in amazing "out of the crate" condition. DIMS: Height 30 Depth 18 Length 60 We ship! -->

Come check out a piece of history today! Only at An Orange Moon. *Original label affixed to underside. Call 773.276.ORANGE The Florence Knoll Coffee table, designed to furnish the new interiors of postwar America, is a scaled-down translation of the lines, gestures and materials of modern architecture. Consistent with all of her designs, the table has a spare, geometric presence that reflects the objective perfectionism and rational design approach Florence Knoll learned from her mentor, Mies van der Rohe. name: Vladimir Sokolov Collage
description:
Vladimir Sokolov was born in 1932 in former Yugoslavia. He was trained and educated in Graphic Design and Fine Art. After visiting the USA in 1965, he decided to come back in 1966 to stay and in 1975 he became a citizen of the USA.

In the early sixties he developed a unique painting style, mixed media-collage influenced by constructivist artist Naum Gabo, a well known teacher from New York.

Vladimir’s most recent works are concerned with issues of form, light, and space in creation of large and mysterious concepts of the Cosmos. 

Vladimir likes to describe his paintings as “a mixture of acrylic, paper, and music!” 

Selected Sokolov exhibitions include:

-Laguna Beach Art Museum
- Downey Art Museum
- Palos Verdes Art Museum
- California-Hawaii Biannual, San Diego Art Museum
- Municipal Art Gallery, Barnsdall Park, Los Angeles
- Festival of Art, City of La Mirada (Best of show)
- All California Juried Show - Laguna Beach Museum
- Muckenthaler Art Center, Fullerton
- “Inland Exhibition X ” San Bernardino
- National Orange Show, San Bernardino
- Mills Hause Visual Center For Art, Garden Grove
- Main Art Gallery- Bank of America Headquarters, San Francisco
- “American Painters In Paris” Paris, France 

This piece measures:
5 feet in height
4 feet in width
5 additional inches all around with a linen mat.

WE CAN SHIP this piece via USPS
Ring 312.450.9821 with questions.
Cheers!
TyLynne

name: American Modern Lounge Chair by Russell Wright for Conant-Ball
description:
WARNING! This chair is dangerously BEAUTIFUL. Adorned in our signature "Blue Tweed" this "American Modern" Lounge chair is statement making!! Are you familiar with Russell Wright? Sure most of us started out collecting his colorful dishware. Remember the Melmac line? How about his spun aluminum line? Those metal tumblers kept water cold for hours! Yes he designed dishware and more! Enter American Modernism--which I think is a marriage of Mid Century Modern and the Art Deco period--long, lean, clean, strong lines. I'm assuming he pulled the "American Modern" design line inspiration from his travels and growing up among American Blue-bloods in upstate New York. He worked with the likes if George Cukor, Norman Bel Geddes and he's said to have paved the way for Martha Stewart and Ralph Lauren! $1495 EACH please. name: Craig Reheis Noted Fort Lauderdale Artist
description:
Cool mid century modern art piece. Full of color and excitement.

Here's the obit.

Fort Lauderdale Artist Craig Reheis, an art pioneer for the city whose first love was always his art, died on Thursday of cancer at Broward General Medical Center. He was 50.

Well-known in the Fort Lauderdale art community, Mr. Reheis opened one of the first galleries on Las Olas Boulevard in the late 1960s when he moved here from Maplewood, N.J.

 ``Las Olas is just now becoming the artist colony that he envisioned 25 years ago when he moved here,`` said Linda Medsker, 37, who met him through her mother, another local artist, 15 years ago. ``People told him he was crazy when he moved to South Federal Highway, but he always did very well... His art work survives him.``

Mr. Reheis` patterned textures, collages and impressionist paintings of cityscapes and boats in dark pastels -- colors that have led some critics to call them wall candy -- are well known in the area. Reheis also is well known for his long years of participation in Promenade in the Park, the Las Olas Art Festival, the Coconut Grove Art Festival, the Winter Park Art Festival and the Gasparilla Art Festival in Tampa.

``He was a multifaceted person who had lots of different talents and interests,`` said business partner and friend, Jon Powers, 30. ``He loved orchids and he loved people. He left a mark with everyone he was involved with.``

Mr. Reheis moved to Fort Lauderdale after a tour in the U.S. Army and several years of traveling and painting in many of the Caribbean islands.

``He was as quick-witted and as funny a person as you would want to meet,`` Medsker said. ``He had a one-liner for every situation, a non-stop monologue. He was extremely upbeat.``

Powers said he learned a lot about the art business through Mr. Reheis, but even more so about life.

DIMS:
27W
37H

Call 773.276.ORAN

name: Self Confessed Furniture Lover for Life
description:
Who remembers this from our last home?? I had to pull myself together when this went out of the shop yesterday. This was our 1st china cabinet as husband and wife. 

Those of you that are customers turned friends have seen this resplendent, magnificent American example of fine furniture making sitting in the dining room of our past residence. Funny we don't miss our last home, but we do miss this piece. 

Sometimes as past Clinicians, we slip back into psych mode and remind clients to "let go," "purge" or simply, "uh, that's a big NO." Now we have to take our own advice. Easier said than done. 

We used to have dinner parties with this. Ty would hide my anniversary gifts inside. I'd lay out cakes, Tequila and stuff my best Parisian linens inside. I'd stash our Limoges & Haviland China, money, Tiffany sterling... Sooo many memories. I'm really surprised at how emotional I am over selling this piece. Oh, did I mention its STILL  my smart phone screen saver. #FeelingVerklempt 

And so it goes. But don't feel sorry for us. We did a Beyonce & Jay-Z and UPGRADED! But still there's a little piece of my heart that is breaking remembering the times. #Selfconfessedfurnitureloverforlife

description:

It’s unquestioningly strong Mid Century Modern design is sooooo ahead of the fray! And besides, Harvey Probber is on FIRE right now! 

How do we decide what inventory is appropriate for AOM? Our inventory gauge is: IS IT SEXY? It’s as simple as that. 

Does the piece crawl to you when you walk in the door of your condo? Is it in the preferred spot in your home? Is it the best place to house your crystal rock glasses while you pour up your best tequila on date night? Does it feel alive? Go ahead, touch it--admire it. name: DUX Mid Century Modern Sofa
description:
This SEXY Mid Century Modern sofa covered in our signature "Gentlemens Grey" fabric is the epitome of what some are calling the "era of sleek" design movement. 

"Era of sleek" hmmm...

Lots of folks are new to the Mid Century Modern furniture scene, hence the sudden influx of MCM furniture groups, with administrators touting their know-it-all to the newly formed masses. 

Just take a look at at the big box stores all knocking off the MCM style. They know whats up! MCM is on FIRE! In every interview we always state that MCM stock is constantly on the rise, and as you can plainly see, this is an investment piece. 

Ok, I digress.
Just look at this sexy, sleek, lean, mean, hot sculpture of a sofa, REFURBISHED to the bone!! Meaning it's not just an upholstery job from some random upholsterer that works out of a basement. It's done by our coveted upholsterer, that by the way, does ONLY MCM!

AND, when I say REFURBISHED that means EVERYTHING. A complete restoration, down to the wood. 

I can't believe this sofa made it to the open market! Will you be the lucky one?

Lynne/Ty McDaniel 
Owners & Founders
